column4: I had to leave to class earlier, anyone here know anything about DRBL?
I cannot boot a DRBL client with a SATA hard drive using Feisty
Are there compatiblity issues with using ubuntu with SATA hard drives?
Set your bios for SATA to be in IDE compatability mode
If you have jmicron chipset you may be ok to insert the driver manually. If another chipset like Marvell or so it could be problemmatic
how can I tell which chipset I am using on the client?
look up your motherboard specs, or try lspci and see if it has some device from jmicron or marvell there
My Asus mb install cd came with source code for Marvell Sata/IDE controller but it's that catch-22 of needing a working system to compile it etc
ok, I'll look up the specs real quick on the dell support site
i did run lspci, i didnt get any information about the driver from that
sorry, i meant chipset
lspci shows you a list of PCI devices and where possible, the manufacturer names it can deduce for that hardware. it doesn't have driver info, just hardware info
its all intel
Likely then Marvell chipset
so if it is a Marvell chipset, just google to find the drivers?
feisty did not work on my Marvell chipset but Gutsy did
You could try to find a deb for that
is gutsy stable enought right now to upgrade to/
I do not think i would recommend it yet for a production machine.
Although i personally have not had any extreme problems with it that were irrecoverable
ok, where would i start to find the deb for marvell?
Perhaps google for such things as: "marvell ide" driver deb
I compiled the source that was on my motherboard cdrom on a second computer into a deb and then transplanted over the deb and installed it that way.
